Pre-Game Insights: Najmul Hossain Shanto believes the side that tackles the conditions better will come out on top.
Logan van Beek said the team have had ‘very nice’ preparations ahead of the match.
The men in orange are confident of bagging an important win over their group rivals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Arnos Vale Stadium has plenty of unknowns surrounding it as it has not hosted an international cricket match in 10 years.
In the past, the pitch has produced an even contest between bat and ball, with spinners finding plenty of success.
While there is no rain forecast, weather conditions will be typically hot and humid.
The two sides have met four times in the T20 format. Bangladesh have won three of those matches, including the most recent one at the T20 World Cup 2022.
Others: Shak Mahedi Hasan could be in line for his first T20 World Cup game, as his tidy off-break bowling and batting abilities could come in handy in the Caribbean.
The Netherlands are unlikely to change their playing XI.
Bangladesh fans will hope their team’s qualification for Super Eights does not come down to prayers.
